dt: {bc}an act or instance of rising up
{bc}a usually localized act of popular violence in defiance usually of an established government

pt: {sc}rebellion{/sc} {sc}revolution{/sc} {sc}uprising{/sc} {sc}revolt{/sc} {sc}insurrection{/sc} {sc}mutiny{/sc} mean an outbreak against authority. {sc}rebellion{/sc} implies an open formidable resistance that is often unsuccessful.
{sc}revolution{/sc} applies to a successful rebellion resulting in a major change (as in government).

pt.t: a political {it}revolution{/it} that toppled the monarchy

pt: {sc}uprising{/sc} implies a brief, limited, and often immediately ineffective rebellion.
{sc}revolt{/sc} and {sc}insurrection{/sc} imply an armed uprising that quickly fails or succeeds.

pt.t: a {it}revolt{/it} by the Young Turks that surprised party leaders

pt: {sc}mutiny{/sc} applies to group insubordination or insurrection especially against naval authority.

pt.t: a {it}mutiny{/it} led by the ship's cook

shortdef: an act or instance of rising up; especially : a usually localized act of popular violence in defiance usually of an established government
